maml:description.maml:para: Get a specific SignalR service or all the SignalR services in a resource group or a subscription.
Get a specific SignalR service or all the SignalR services in a resource group or a subscription.
SignalR service name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Resource group name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Resource group name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The SignalR service resource ID.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
SignalR service name.
Resource group name.
The SignalR service resource ID.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Get all SignalR services in the subscription ---------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalR
HostName Location ServerPort PublicPort ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- ---------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Succeeded 1.0 mysignalr2.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Succeeded 1.0 mysignalr3.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Creating 1.0

command:example.maml:title: --------- Get all SignalR services in a resource group ---------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup
HostName Location ServerPort PublicPort ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- ---------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Succeeded 1.0 mysignalr2.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Succeeded 1.0

command:example.maml:title: ---------------- Get a specific SignalR service ----------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -Name mysignalr1
HostName Location ServerPort PublicPort ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- ---------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Succeeded 1.0

command:example.maml:title: Get a specific SignalR service from the default resource group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalR -Name mysignalr2
HostName Location ServerPort PublicPort ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- ---------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr2.service.signalr.net eastus 5002 5001 Succeeded 1.0

dev:remarks.maml:para: The default resource group can be set by `Set-AzDefault -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup`.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Get access keys of a specific SignalR service --------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalRKey -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -Name mysignalr1
Name : mysignalr1 PrimaryKey : vmYRhoM62PMkNe/CSSPdMSxokn+WZEFmOQNt77PovDs= PrimaryConnectionString : Endpoint=https://mysignalr1.service.signalr.net;AccessKey=vmYRhoM62PMkNe/CSSPdMSxokn+WZEFmO QNt77PovDs=; SecondaryKey : 2+HkuxAA34xiZFFiDsVM0uDyzCsg6GKsdXSjN4C/YFQ= SecondaryConnectionString : Endpoint=https://mysignalr1.service.signalr.net;AccessKey=2+HkuxAA34xiZFFiDsVM0uDyzCsg6GKsd XSjN4C/YFQ=;

command:example.maml:title: ---- Get access keys from a SignalR service object in pipe ----
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -Name mysignalr1 | Get-AzSignalRKey
Name : mysignalr1 PrimaryKey : vmYRhoM62PMkNe/CSSPdMSxokn+WZEFmOQNt77PovDs= PrimaryConnectionString : Endpoint=https://mysignalr1.service.signalr.net;AccessKey=vmYRhoM62PMkNe/CSSPdMSxokn+WZEFmO QNt77PovDs=; SecondaryKey : 2+HkuxAA34xiZFFiDsVM0uDyzCsg6GKsdXSjN4C/YFQ= SecondaryConnectionString : Endpoint=https://mysignalr1.service.signalr.net;AccessKey=2+HkuxAA34xiZFFiDsVM0uDyzCsg6GKsd XSjN4C/YFQ=;

command:example.maml:title: -------- Get the usage quota by inputting the location --------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSignalRUsage eastus
Name CurrentValue Limit ---- ------------ ----- FreeTierInstances 2 5 SignalRTotalUnits 3 300

maml:description.maml:para: Create a SignalR service.
Create a SignalR service. The following values will be used for the parameters if not specified: * `ResourceGroupName`: the default resource group set by `Set-AzDefault -ResourceGroupName`.
* `Location`: the location of the resource group
* `Sku`: `Standard_S1`
The SignalR service name.
The allowed origins for the SignalR service. To allow all, use "*" and remove all other origins from the list. Slashes are not allowed as part of domain or after TLD
Run the cmdlet in background job.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The SignalR service location. The resource group location will be used if not specified.
The resource group name. The default one will be used if not specified.
The service mode for the SignalR service.
The SignalR service SKU.
The tags for the SignalR service.
The SignalR service unit count, from 1 to 10. Default to 1.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The allowed origins for the SignalR service. To allow all, use "*" and remove all other origins from the list. Slashes are not allowed as part of domain or after TLD
Run the cmdlet in background job.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The SignalR service location. The resource group location will be used if not specified.
The SignalR service name.
The resource group name. The default one will be used if not specified.
The service mode for the SignalR service.
The SignalR service SKU.
The tags for the SignalR service.
The SignalR service unit count, from 1 to 10. Default to 1.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------- Create a SignalR service -------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup1 -Name mysignalr1 -Location eastus -Sku Standard_S1 -UnitCount 5
HostName Location ExternalIp Sku UnitCount ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- --- --------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 52.179.3.5 Standard_S1 5 Succeeded 1.0

command:example.maml:title: ------------ Specify ServiceMode and AllowedOrigin ------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup1 -Name mysignalr2 -Location eastus -ServiceMode Serverless -AllowedOrigin http://example1.com:12345, https://example2.cn
HostName Location ExternalIp Sku UnitCount ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- --- --------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 52.179.3.5 Standard_S1 1 Succeeded 1.0

maml:description.maml:para: Set the upstream settings of a SignalR service.
Set the upstream settings of a SignalR service.
Run the cmdlet in background job.
Clear all the upstream settings.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The SignalR resource object.

Template item(s) for upstream settings. Required key: UrlTemplate. Optional keys: HubPattern, EventPattern, CategoryPattern. Example using splatting syntax to pass templates parameter: @{UrlTemplate='http://host-connections1.com', HubPattern= 'chat';EventPattern='broadcast' },@{UrlTemplate='http://host-connections2.com'}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The SignalR service name.
Run the cmdlet in background job.
Clear all the upstream settings.

The resource group name. The default one will be used if not specified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Set two ordered upstream templates --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Set-AzSignalRUpstream -name pssignalr -ResourceGroupName test_resource_group -Template @{UrlTemplate='http://host-connections1.com'; HubPattern='chat';EventPattern='broadcast' }, @{UrlTemplate='http://host-connections2.com'}
Templates --------- {Microsoft.Azure.Commands.SignalR.Models.PSUpstreamTemplate, Microsoft.Azure.Commands.SignalR.Models.PSUpstreamTemplat

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following JSON represents the actual templates set.

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Clear all the upstream settings ---------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Set-AzSignalRUpstream -name pssignalr -ResourceGroupName test_resource_group -Clear
Templates --------- {}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------- Check an existed name. --------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Test-AzSignalRName -Name existedsignalr -Location eastus False

command:example.maml:title: ------------------- Check an unexisted name. -------------------
command:example.dev:code: powershell PS C:\> Test-AzSignalR unexistedsignalr eastus True

maml:description.maml:para: Update a SignalR service.

The allowed origins for the SignalR service. To allow all, use "*" and remove all other origins from the list. Slashes are not allowed as part of domain or after TLD

The SignalR service unit count, value only from {1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100}. Default to 1.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Update a specific SignalR service. --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Update-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup -Name mysignalr1 -UnitCount 5
HostName Location ExternalIp Sku UnitCount ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- --- --------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 52.179.3.5 Standard_S1 5 Succeeded 1.0

command:example.maml:title: ------------ Specify ServiceMode and AllowedOrigin ------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Update-AzSignalR -ResourceGroupName myResourceGroup1 -Name mysignalr2 -ServiceMode Serverless -AllowedOrigin http://example1.com:12345, https://example2.cn
HostName Location ExternalIp Sku UnitCount ProvisioningState Version -------- -------- ---------- --- --------- ----------------- ------- mysignalr1.service.signalr.net eastus 52.179.3.5 Standard_S1 1 Succeeded 1.0

maml:description.maml:para: Update the Network ACL of a SignalR service.
Update the Network ACL of a SignalR service, including the default action and the network Acls for public and private connection.
Allowed network ACLs
Run the cmdlet in background job.

Default Action of SignalR network ACLs, either allow or deny. It decides whether deny network ACLs or allow network ACLs take effect. For example, if the default action is allow, then only the deny ACLs matters.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Denied network ACLs
The SignalR resource object.
Name(s) of private endpoint(s) to be updated
Update public network ACLs
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The SignalR service name.
Allowed network ACLs
Run the cmdlet in background job.

Update public network ACLs

command:example.maml:title: Allow RESTAPI,ClientConnection for public network and set default action to Deny
Allow client connection and server connection for a private endpoint connection
Deny client connection for both public network and a private endpoint connection
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$networkAcl = Update-AzSignalRNetworkAcl -Name pssignalr -ResourceGroupName test_resource_group -PrivateEndpointName pssignalr.70197ffc-d138-49a5-a336-98b21a8d04d1 -PublicNetwork -Deny ClientConnection
